entry.title: Combined summary - bitcoin-java, a new bitcoin library
entry.summary: Humberto Marcolino, the owner of the repository https://github.com/bitcoin-education/bitcoin-java, has developed a new open-source Bitcoin library written in Java with support for taproot single key transactions. The library was created primarily for educational purposes and to provide a leaner alternative to bitcoinj, which is too feature-heavy. It does not include features that allow communication with nodes or any online features, making it ideal for developers who want to build a wallet in Java. Developers are welcome to provide feedback, PRs, and issues on the project's website, where Humberto plans to post more examples using it: https://www.bitcoineducation.site/.Steve, a member of the Bitcoin Dev Kit project, responded to Humberto's announcement and suggested that Humberto take a look at their project on GitHub, which is building support for Kotlin/Java and eventually Swift and iOS. He also mentioned that joining their team would be a great way to learn about the primitives for on-chain Bitcoin.Humberto has also created a discord server for the project where developers can collaborate. Mohamed Youssef, a member of the bitcoin-dev community, expressed interest in the library and asked if there were plans for a slack or IRC for collaboration.
